WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closing, since this has probably been resolved with the recent work on the new solver.
WorkItem.Description:
I was optimizing my Boomkin today, when I noticed something I believe to be odd behavior. This discussion is concerning T12 Normal gear levels, so I'll be excluding heroic trinkets from this post.
 
According to this post ( http://elitistjerks.com/f73/t110353-balance_cataclysm_4_2_a/#post1953583 ) and the OP of the same thread, DMC:V and Necromantic Focus are supposed to be BiS T12N, with VPLC coming at a very close second. However, when I open a blank Rawr profile, VPLC is shown to be miles ahead of Focus and DMC:V. 
 
Since the information I'm seeing directly conflicts with the chart on EJ, I'm wondering is perhaps VPLC is overvalued in some way, or if the information in the EJ post is too out of date (it was made just last month, and I don't recall any changes made to trinkets).

Comments.Message: What do you mean, a blank profile?  If you mean a new boomkin with no character loaded, then none of the gear rankings are valid because you have no raid buffs and no stats.

Sorry, I should have clarified. I merely meant that I hadn't done any item edits, and that the information/steps to recreate could be done from just opening a blank Boomkin and inputting your gear.

I've attached the profile in question. From what I can tell, VPLC is about 300 "points" ahead of DMC:V, and roughly 200 "points" ahead of Focus.
Try it again in the latest version, as I did some minor changes to the calculation of damage procs like VPLC.  Make sure you're not looking at the heroic versions of the trinkets, also.

Created a new Boomkin profile (see the 2nd upload). Gear is a little bit different, but still getting roughly the same results. Using Rawr 4.2.3.0

Showing VLPC (i384) at 2748 points, DMC:V (i359) at 2328, and Focus (i378) is coming in at 2546. I've triple-checked the item levels.

Please understand that I'm not trying to imply that you've made some kind of error with the trinket. I'm just trying to reconcile the two (three, with WrathCalcs) sources of Boomkin information I'm familiar with and rely on for gearing decisions.

I see the behavior you're experiencing, but interestingly enough, if I load a different moonkin profile, the trinkets are in their "proper" order.  I don't know quite what to tell you; trinket math is a very unusual discipline, and despite my best efforts, things always come out differently between the three sources.  I'm not going to close this straightaway, as I will take some time to look at how WrathCalcs handles the VPLC before I come to a final conclusion.
